p:
Sofosbuvir (SOF) is a nucleotide analogue targeted against the HCV polymerase, NS5B. The structure of HCV bound to SOF
13 reveals that the drug binds to the active site and is incorporated into the nascent strand preventing the addition of the next nucleotide. The residues that participate in SOF binding include motif A’s D225, motif B’s S282, T287, and N291 (the latter binds to the SOF 2′-F), motif F’s K141 and R158, plus motif A’s and C’s universally conserved aspartates that coordinate the metal ions
13 . Previous work has shown that SOF has in vitro and/or in vivo antiviral activity against other Flaviviruses, i.e. Dengue, Zika, and the West Nile Virus
14– 16 . The RdRp structural conservation extends beyond the Flaviviridae members and includes all known RNA viruses
8 .
